byline.contributor: Kiki Zhao and Mia Li contributed research.

abstract: Mengke Glacier, one of largest glaciers in China, is receding fast as temperatures continue to climb; glacier retreat is leading to devastation in lowland valleys and is threatening Asia's water supply.
lead_paragraph: The Mengke Glacier in northwest China is receding fast, and towns along an arid corridor have suffered floods and landslides caused by sudden rainstorms.

headline.main: Chinese Glacier’s Retreat Signals Trouble for Asian Water Supply
headline.print_headline: Chinese Glacier’s Retreat Signals Trouble for Asian Water Supply

snippet: The Mengke Glacier in northwest China is receding fast, and towns along an arid corridor have suffered floods and landslides caused by sudden rainstorms.

keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
keywords.name: subject
